Package lighting

Interface LightSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
DirectionalLight, PointLight, SpotLight
public interface LightSource
LightSource is an interface representing a light source in a scene. It provides methods to get the intensity of the light at a specific point and to calculate the distance from the light source to a given point. Authors: Noga Jacobs and Noa

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    getDistance(Point point)
    Get the distance from the light source to a given point.
    Color
    getIntensity(Point p)
    Get the light intensity at a specified point in the scene.
    Vector
    getL(Point p)
    Get the direction vector from the light source to a given point.
    List<Vector>
    listGetL(Point p, Vector n)
    Get the direction vectors from the light source to a given point.

  • Method Details

    • getIntensity

      Color getIntensity(Point p)
      Get the light intensity at a specified point in the scene.
      Parameters:
      p - The point at which the intensity of the light is calculated.
      Returns:
      The color intensity of the light at the specified point.

    • getDistance

      double getDistance(Point point)
      Get the distance from the light source to a given point. This method should be overridden by any class that implements this interface.
      Parameters:
      point - The point for which the distance to the light source is calculated.
      Returns:
      The distance from the light source to the specified point.

    • listGetL

      List<Vector> listGetL(Point p, Vector n)
      Get the direction vectors from the light source to a given point.
      Parameters:
      p - The point for which the direction vectors are calculated.
      n - The normal vector at the specified point.
      Returns:
      A list of direction vectors from the light source to the specified point.

    • getL

      Vector getL(Point p)
      Get the direction vector from the light source to a given point.
      Parameters:
      p - The point for which the direction vector is calculated.
      Returns:
      The direction vector from the light source to the specified point.
